official-title.#text: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a global rare earth element assessment, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Resource Assessment of Rare Earths Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Resource Assessment of Rare Earths Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Global rare earth element resource assessment

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and in coordination with the heads of national geological surveys where available, shall submit to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the United States Geological Survey
Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a comprehensive report on global rare earth element resources and potential future global supply. Such report shall use the best available data and include—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate

text.#text: Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the
the identity and quantity of individual rare earth elements in known deposits;
models demonstrating the geologic conditions necessary for the formation, and the variability in composition, of the most significant deposits of rare earth elements;
regional assessments of the likelihood of occurrence of undiscovered deposits and an estimate of the quantity of rare earth elements thought to be present;
recommendations, developed in consultation with other appropriate agencies, on areas of need for future geologic research related to—
other minerals that are critical based on the impact of a potential supply restriction and the likelihood of a supply restriction; and

analysis, developed with participation by the National Minerals Information Center and in consultation with appropriate agencies, of the rare earth elements supply chain and associated processes and products, including mining, processing, separation, metal production, alloy production, and manufacturing of products sold to end users.

any element in the lanthanides group of elements, which consists of lanthanum, cerium, praseodymium, neodymium, promethium, samarium, europium, gadolinium, terbium, dysprosium, holmium, erbium, thulium, ytterbium, and lutetium;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Resource Assessment of Rare Earths Act of 2013/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: $10,000,000 for the period of fiscal years 2014 through 2016

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the
